answerText: Beer-Lambert-Bouger Law[10] The Beer-Lambert law states that absorbance is equal to extinction coefficient times path length times this quantity. This quantity is the thing you actually want to find when using a spectrophotometer.
heading: Penn Bowl |2013 | 7 | 3 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This law only applies when the incident light is monochromatic. [10] Name this law commonly used in spectrophotometers, which relates absorbance to path length.
